headline: Garlic Parmesan Monkey Bread
description: If you like garlic bread you'll love this! This savory version of the classic Monkey Bread is sure to add fun and flavor to any meal.

video.description: Start the party with cheesy pull apart bread!
video.name: Garlic Parmesan Monkey Bread

name: Garlic Parmesan Monkey Bread
recipeIngredient: 2 (1 pound) loaves frozen bread dough, thawed

recipeInstructions.text: Grease a 10 inch Bundt pan or tube pan.

In a medium bowl, mix together the green onion, parsley, garlic powder, salt, butter and eggs until well blended. Break the bread dough off in walnut-sized pieces, and dip each piece into the egg mixture.

Place coated dough balls into the prepared pan. Once there is a layer of balls covering the bottom of the pan, sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Repeat, sprinkling each layer with cheese until everything is in the pan. Cover loosely, and let rise until doubled in size, about 45 minutes. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown.

review.reviewBody: Loved it! I didn't get my frozen bread dough defrosted in time, so I crossed my fingers and used 3 cans of Pillsbury French Bread loaves. Since I used those instead I didn't have to wait for the rise time. Browned beautifully and no problem getting it out of the pan. In addition to the spices in the recipe I also added 2 t. Momofuku Savory Seasoning Salt and additional garlic powder. Will make again.

Amazing! Followed recipe here and it was delicious. Everyone wanted the recipe. Even my non onion loving relative (I didn't say there were green onions in it) loved it. There were no leftovers. Highly recommend and I will be making this again and again!
I added Penzey’s Italian Herb Mix (1 tbsp) and 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese and made my dough in the bread machine! Used your (Allrecipes) recipe for Best bread machine white bread recipe!!

This is so good. I used real garlic and used a chopper. About a handful. Also used pillsbury biscuits. 2 packs of big ones. I then put Monterey Jack/ Colby shredded cheese and put that in middle of each ball. Did everything else the same. I have made twice in two weeks now. Whole family loves it
it lol i used 4 cans of biscuits cut in 4’s whenever i make this bread ham and potato soup is served with it its like they were ment to be together i swear lol thanks for sharing

Its a great recipe as a base. I swoped all onions and herbs for my own combination of italian herbs, i added two spoons of crushed garlic over and above the powder garlic and I brushed it with a butter garlic amd herb mix when it came out the oven because my family likes soft crusts. But even then the cheese wa soft in between the individual buns etc. I so used a rectangle cake tray but it still came out pretty and delicious.
It was great

I added basil and oregano...and added 4 tblspns of olive oil to the melted butter mixture. I also just added half of the dipped pieces then added the parm and a half cup of shredded mozzarella...then I added the other dipped pieces of dough. I baked 45 minutes...turned the oven off and let it set another 10ish minutes.
Awesome - will definitely be making this again
I have made this many times. My family loves it. I left off the green onions and have experimented with different cheeses. Our favorite is asiago. My son makes it for his friends.

I used white and wheat dough (more colorful and the texture and taste is different). I didn't use green onions, my husband has acid reflex, instead I used powdered onion. I used more garlic. I think next time I will use bread pans to cook it in, in the future (the middle of large baking dish wasn't done).

This recipe is amazing! I did what another user suggested and cut it semi frozen into pieces and dipped frozen pieces into the mix and let it rise that way. I also added mozz cheese! So so good! My family loved it

I made this by making the dough in my bread machine, making the dough balls and freezing them. Then when we went to our annual cabin get together I brought the dry ingredients premeasured. The dough had thawed and I assembled quickly. Beautiful it went great with my premade lasagna and with a little freezer dinner prep the weekend before I had a easy dinner for 10 without missing out on the visiting. I followed the recipe except using fresh dried chives and sprinkling mozzarella in the layers. What a hit. Everyone raved. It is a staple in my box now.
I loved this! I too didn't have green onion and added some extra garlic and it turned out great!
Not enough flavor, plus the eggs, though mixed thoroughly into the butter, separated and "scrambled" on the bottom of the bundt pan!

Wow! did this not work out for us. I didn't have an issue with not having enough mix to coat the bread balls, but I did have a huge issue with it not coming out the pan which I greased the heck out of and so of course it wasn't very pretty to look at. Also, there just really wasn't much in the way of flavor. Hardly anyone had more than one bite and I just threw most of it away.

Wow! did this not work out for us. I didn't have an issue with not having enough mix to coat the bread balls, but I did have a huge issue with it not coming out the pan which I greased the heck out of and so of course it wasn't very pretty to look at. Also, there just really wasn't much in the way of flavor. Hardly anyone had more than one bite and I just threw most of it away.
Turned out well with biscuit dough. It was a hit with the pizza sauce. I would add more garlic next time and will try with actual bread dough

My husband is REAL finicky about his food and especially about garlic bread. HE LOVES THIS BREAD! He asked me just 2 days ago to make it again. And so I am. Right after I submit this review. He RARELY asks for repeats of 'new' recipes, so is speaking volumes that he actually asks me to make it again. And again. And again. I kid you not. Y'all NEED to have this one on a regular rotation.

Ok, I didn't have any green onion. I used 2 cans of Pillsbury Grands Buttermilk Biscuits. I left the biscuits whole and just sliced them in the center. I dipped the first can of biscuits in the butter mixture & put them in my bundt pan. I sprinkled cheddar cheese and Parmesean then on them & more butter then I put the 2nd can of biscuits on top. Added more cheddar & Parmesean and drenched it with butter. I sprinkled extra garlic powder on top. This was the best garlic bread I've ever tasted. The ones at Red Lobster can't compare. Thank you.
My family and I love this recipe. TFS!
This was a bit like garlic knots, which my kids love. I did add some fresh garlic in addition to the garlic powder, and I only managed to make 1-1/2 layers. which was fine. I'll make it again.
Really good bread. I used frozen dinner rolls that were slow to rise after 45 minutes. I put them in the oven anyway and they turned out perfectly.
Made this for game night with family to test this out for next weekend. We could not stop eating it. It was wonderful, just as written.
Good but could use a touch more garlic (and I plan to use the real stuff) to make it better. Will definitely make this one again soon

I loved it, I halved the recipe and cooked in bread pan. I had the Rhodes dinner rolls on hand so used those instead,cut up. did add minced garlic and a llittle mozzarella after reading recommendation. Turned out delishous and was good the next day also. Would make again.
I made this as is for an appetizer. It was so good! Next time I will serve it with a side of marinara for dipping. It's pretty addictive!
great
Very tasty
Great recipe & super easy! Def need to spray your pan well or it will STICK!!! Family loved it dipped in Alfredo sauce. Will make again!
very easy to make and was gone in a hurry. everyone loved it
All of my family loved it
Simple and quick. I used fresh garlic instead of powder since we were out of it. Kids loved it. Great for dipping!
Made dough in bread maker, mixed Parmesan with butter , warmed in low heat oven

This simple recipe turned out to be exceptionally delicious. We pretty much followed recipe as is except for baking at a slightly lower temperature for 30 min longer. Opposite to what some people said, I actully ended up with extra dipping mixture and poured that mixture over the bread. I think that's why I had to bake it for longer, but it made it super tasty. I used vegetable oil instead of butter to make it healthier. The bread tasted best when it was fresh out of oven. It tasted slightly oily the next day, but still delicious. For the healthier eaters out there, choose a healthy bread dough makes a difference.
Made this to go with my family's favorite Upside Down Spaghetti. Everyone loved it!
If you want the butter and herbs to stick to the dough better, cut dough while it is still frozen! Cold dough solidifies the butter/herb combination thicker. Let rise then bake. AMAZING.

I have made this recipe many times. My family is not crazy about onions, so I omit the white part of the onion. I also use a clove of minced garlic instead of garlic powder. You can use frozen bread dough, but I prefer Rhodes frozen dinner rolls. Don't use refrigerated biscuit dough, the results are subpar IMHO. Enjoy!

My daughter is in culinary school - she couldn't wait to make this recipe - however, she made bread dough from scratch and didn't put cheese in between the layers. She also used a bit more herbs and spices. It was phenomenal!

Great basic recipe! I added 3 TSP of minced garlic because we love garlic but that was the only modification I made. Yummo!! Next time I may add some mozzarella or cheddar. Possibilities are endless!!
The family loved it. Based on other reviews I increased the garlic powder to 2 tsp and omitted the green onions. In my oven, it required 35 mins to be cooked through.
This is a great way to keep from making bread all day, with proofing several times, and the taste is really good. Nice job!
This is a good recipe, but I have a couple of hints. Don't leave out the salt. Bread needs salt. Use good cheese.
This is wonderful.... tasty, easy, and enjoyed by many at family events. Thanks so much
Outstanding!!!

Extremely easy and awesomely delicious! I did not have garlic powder so I substituted with about a tablespoon of minced garlic (the kind that you can buy in a tube). I also used a parmesan romano cheese mix. Came out smelling delicious and did not taste too garlic-y. 

Because I did not have a bundt pan, I used a crock-pot (just the removable ceramic part) and cut the bread into slices. I did not have to grease the pot and the bread pulled away from the walls without any problems. 

Next time, I will have to make the balls smaller so the butter and cheese gets more distributed throughout the bread.
This was good...... I had to cook it for 30 min and then cover with foil to cook another 30min. I used frozen dinner roll dough and a bundt pan. Brushed the top with melted butter. Yum!

I found this recipe to be simple and delicious...with a few modifications.

First, make sure to grease the top edge of the pan, even on the outside to keep the rolls from sticking (as they will rise above the top). Also place a piece of foil in the bottom of the oven to catch spills.

I used Rhodes frozen dinner rolls and only one egg, omitted the salt, added a stick of butter and a tablespoon of minced garlic (in addition to the garlic powder), made sure to chop the green onions and parsley extra fine, and used 1/4 cup shredded Parmesan, 1/4 cup Colby/Jack and 1/4 cup Mozzarella cheeses. I blended all ingredients together in one bowl and dipped each ball into the mixture -- there was just enough.

After baking for 20 minutes, I placed a piece of foil over the top of the pan and baked 15 minutes longer than the recipe calls for.

Since the recipe doesn't specify what you do after baking I did the following:

Remove pan from oven, immediately inverting it onto a plate, loosen the rolls from the pan and allow it all to sit for about 10 minutes before removing the pan from over the rolls. Sprinkle the top with 1/4 cup shredded Parmesan and lay a piece of foil (loosely) over the top for about 10 minutes so the cheese will melt. Allow to cool completely (uncovered).

I found it best to slice individual cake-sized pieces to create a cheese swirled bread. I served this with my own version of the trending "Pizza Casserole" and it was a huge hit! I will definitely make it again!
A flavorful bread. Easy to make.
I didn't have enough of the butter/egg mixture for both loaves--only about one-and-a-half, so I will double next time. And, yes, as a garlic lover, needs lots more garlic!
I found it lacking in its buttery flavor, and not overly flavorful. I gave it three stars, though, due to its ease in making and the attractiveness of the dish when served.

My family loved it, said I could make it again next week. Followed comments and doubled garlic, that helped. Also doubled dipping mix. For me it was too much dipping sauce and tossed a lot of it. For some reason, it didn't pull apart like we thought, but that didn't stop my boys. They just ripped away.

Made this for dinner with a chunky tomatoe sauce for dipping. I used pizza dough, one egg, 3 heaping tablespoons of butter and 5 cloves of fresh minced garlic. The pizza dough was crispy on the outside and soft and moist on the inside. The dough sucked up all the juices and flavours, it was amazing!!! It stuck to my bundt pan but I think I didnt grease it enough...will make again!!!!
Very easy and worthwhile. I didn't have a bundt pan, but it still looked nice in a regular round pan.
My family loved this, easy to make and turned out perfect!

Soooo good. I served this with pasta and doubled the parmesan. You can add any herbs you like and it turns out excellent. If you don't have the right pan just use a regular pie pan and put a mason jar in the middle of it.

Soooo good. I served this with pasta and doubled the parmesan. You can add any herbs you like and it turns out excellent. If you don't have the right pan just use a regular pie pan and put a mason jar in the middle of it.
Made it last night...it's like eating a savoury Angel food cake.......FANTASTIC. Melts in your mouth.

This is a great base but I had to make too many changes to give it a higher rating. I didnt use frozen dough, I whipped up a batch of "Sy's Challah" from this site. I also omitted the green onion/eggs, used minced garlic instead of the powder and had to up the butter to approx 1/2 cup as what was listed wasnt nearly enough. I made two for a dinner party and everyone gobbled them up!

This was good, I added about 1 teaspoon of chopped garlic to the recipe. Next time I'll make the pieces of dough bigger, the size of golf balls 'cause all those little pieces were a lot of trouble for the end result... it does turn out into one big chunk.
Great recipe - I made it with the biscuits and it turned out great. Added rosemary and an extra clove of grated garlic for more flavour.

I thought this was good. Other folks really liked it. I did a tb. of garlic powder, and used garlic salt instead of regular salt. I also added a tb. of Herbs de Provence. Next time I will add more garlic (chop some real garlic) and make sure to flour the pan instead of just greasing.
This is easy with the frozen bread dough. I made a half batch tonight to eat with tomorrow's lunch. It smelled so good, we had to try it immediately. It was great!
This bread is amazing! I also tried this recipe using cinnamon bun filling instead and the cinnamon balls were fantastic as well.

This was a great accompaniment to our Christmas dinner. I worried that people would think that it was weird to pull bread apart with your hands at a nice holiday meal, but it was not a concern. Everyone loved it. Thanks!

Delicious! Made it for thanksgiving and the family loved it. I used 2 dozen frozen rolls and cut them in half and I omitted the green onion as some family members are picky. Was terrific and next time I will add the green onion and use aged cheddar for something a little different

This is quite a treat! I used a recipe from this site to make the dough. ( best bread machine bread) I used regular bread pans and it worked just fine. I've made it several times now using different spices and cheeses, and it is fantastic every time. Thanks for the recipe...
Delicious!! Everyone LOVED it! The only thing I did different was I subbed real garlic instead of garlic powder and added a bit of rosemary. Thanks for the recipe!|
This is really good i made one change though after placing them in the pan i added mozzarella cheese and then parmasean cheese on top it was delicious!!!

We made an Italian feast for Fathers Day and I wanted to serve Garlic bread and another variety of bread. This was such a hit! Not only was it delicious, it gave a great presentation when being served. The only thing I did different was replace fresh minced garlic for the garlic powder. Thanks!
I cut this down to 1 loaf of frozen bread and cut the other ingredients down also. Then just made it in a bread pan ... YUM!
I also use the buttermilk biscuits that come in a tube, rather than the bread dough. It's a simple recipe that always gets rave reviews!
Excellent! I'll be making this again for our next family dinner.

I live in a very small town, so I have trouble finding a lot of ingredients. Can someone please tell me which "frozen bread dough loaves" I'm supposed to get??? And if I can't get it here, can anyone recommend an alternative to this? I'd really appreciate it! Thanks!

This recipe was great although I added more ingredients along with what the recipe calls for I added oregano, chili peppers, red onion instead of green onions and pepper I also used allot more garlic. I found 30 min. was not enough cooking time so I covered it with foil after 30 min and cooked it for 45 min. I will be making this bread again my family loved it!
Made this for Thanksgiving, in a 9 x 9 pan (or pans...don't remember). Kinda messy to make but very good.
I wasnt crazy about the end result, but it is a good idea.

This recipe worked wonderfully, with one change. Based on other reviews, I doubled the amount of garlic powder used (I used granulated garlic), but it was still not quite garlicky enough for my taste. I would probably add a clove of pressed garlic to the mixture to really kick it up a notch.
Amazing recipe! I doubled the dipping ingredients and allowed it to rise for 1.5 hours. I baked it for 50 minutes! DELISH!

This recipe is AMAZING!! I have made it multiple times. I of course added a little bit extra of all the "good stuff". I have served this bread with steak, thai food, chicken, and stews. It goes great with it all.

Not near enough flavor for me but then I like LOTS of flavor. I followed the recipe and didn't add or change anything but I was so disappointed and I hate to write a bad review. Just wondering what I could have done wrong because there are so many good reviews.
This recipe is some! The only thing I did differently is I used Rhodes frozen rolls (thawed) and dried chives since I didn't have any green onions on hand. I will be making this recipe again!
A bit strong in taste but okay.
Great variation to the sweet monkey bread.

This has been a REALLY BIG hit at the 3 parties I have made this for. Cooking time seems to vary; I set my timer for 25 min and checked it every couple of minutes until I felt it was done. If you really like a lot of garlic, add more. I make it as is. Another party goer brought a buffalo chicken dip and this dipped in that is sensational!
I have made this bread several times and it was a big hit each time.....
I made this at Christmas! It was a hit. People were very impressed with the look of it too. I am making it again tonight!
Very good - easy and different

As written it is good, but we did feel it needed a bit more garlic & salt. I did add some cheddar cheese but otherwise followed the recipe as written. It went over well for Valentine's Day. Will be making again and adding fresh minced garlic and a tad more salt. Thanks for the recipe!

Very good! I made this exactly as written except for putting a little shredded mozarella cheese on top before letting rise before baking. I think next time I will add a little more salt to the egg mixture, but other than that this was a delicious and beautiful bread! I made it in my heart shaped tube pan for Valentine's Day dinner and it was perfect! I will be using this recipe again. Thanks for sharing. :)
Needs more garlic powder or some fresh garlic. Other than that it was tasty and pretty. The kids thought it was a treat to pull their own bread.

Excellent, excellent, excellent!!! Served with aged. slow roasted prime rib, ceasar salad with homemade dressing, and brussel sprouts braised in heavy cream and nutmeg. Between 6 adults there was only 1 small piece left.

This bread turned out to be okay. I used 2 cans of refrigerated bisuits instead of the frozen bread. I also added 2 tsp. of garlic powder. I think this recipe called for too much butter because in the middle of the bread I could see the excess butter floating on top of the bread. This is a good recipe,but I think next time I will use less butter. Other than that the bread was very tasty!

This was disappointing. It didn't turn out very good. I thought it sounded strange to use green onion, but I tried it anyway. I didn't like the taste of the onion mixed with the garlic, butter and parsley. I might try doing this again, but with some modifications. It seemed like a great idea.

It was great! I didn't have the time to individually dip each piece so I just tossed them all together. I would suggest cutting a tad smaller, because then each bite will have more garlic glaze on iy. So yummy.
This was great! But I would like to try it with homemade bread dough, since I could tell a difference between the frozen and homemade. But when you haven't the time, it is great as written.

This was fabulous! I was in a time-crunch and had forgotten to thaw the frozen bread loaf, so I used two cans of refrigerated French Bread dough (the kind that is next to the cinnamon rolls and pre-made cookie dough at the store). Other than that, I followed the recipe to a tee and it was perfect!! We used large chunks of it as our "dinner roll" with our Thanksgiving meal and everyone said it was delicious!!!

I made this (first time) for Thanksgiving. I used the Alternative of buttermilk biscuits to save time. At first everyone thought they were going to have too much garlic... but once out of the oven we couldn't stop eating them!

This bread was really a treat for my family. I made it exactly as stated in the recipe and it came out perfect. I greased my nonstick bundt pan and the bread came out with very little coaxing. I will definately make this again. But my family really didn't know how to approch cutting it so we just ripped off chunks. It was very amusing and fun for the family!
